Is Smoking that bad for you?

While cigarettes may have a bad reputation for all their health risks, they offer many benefits for mental wellbeing, social interaction, focusing and so many more that might show how cigarettes are not the big bad picture that the media has painted them as. While we are all aware of the terrible side effects of smoking, many do not know the benefits of smoking recreationally. Beyond the physical addiction that cigarettes form they also serve as a tool for stress relief which can be very addicting to many people living in this crazy world where it feels like you just canâ€™t catch a break. This different perspective may raise eyebrows but in reality cigarettes just might not be as bad as they sound.

Smoking can increase focus and has been shown to improve productivity in many situations. Nicotine can make the brain focus better making it easier for someone to focus and get work done. Cigarettes have also been shown to make more mentally happy employees. This is due to structured regular and more refreshing breaks. This creates a reward system for the brain. It shows the brain the more you focus the more dopamine is released into the body. Which are also why cigarettes can be so amazing due to their euphoric feeling while smoking one.

Cigarettes also helps many less social people socialize better acting as an icebreaker for many. Smoking a cigarette with another person can break the ice and show common interests for many laying as a foundation for building a friendship. This while also giving an activity to do for either a group only a few people. Smoking also combats boredom by giving the smoker some quick and easy to do while also having a feeling of accomplishment due to the dopamine rushing through you. While there are all these benefits there are also downsides such as addiction and side effects of smoking.
